The data set represents the scores of students who took a standardized college placement exam at their own school and later took the same test at a neighboring school. Based on the data, which of the following conclusions can be made?

choices.label: Participants scored better when testing in a familiar location.
Participants performed better when in a similar physiological state.
The familiar location caused the studentsâ€™ scores to decrease.
Participants scores were better at their home schools because their teachers proctored the exams.

content.answer: Participants scored better when testing in a familiar location.

skill.text: 3.C: Interpret quantitative or qualitative inferential data from a given table, graph, chart, figure, or diagram.
